title: Communication, Language, and Literacy Part A and Part B
subject: Prekindergarten Learning Standards (2019-)

document.title: RESOURCE GUIDES FOR SCHOOL SUCCESS: THE PREKINDERGARTEN EARLY LEARNING STANDARDS

2B056E5B016B4719BF06E56EA31958D0.description:
Uses words and phrases acquired through language rich experiences, conversations,
reading and being read to, responding to texts, and child-centered, play-based experiences

54744C5C315840C6B7DC21A13AAB5621.description: Demonstrates understanding of frequently occurring words by relating them to their opposites (e.g., hot/cold)

2F580F2AD76247CB864FAAE03B3DC21E.description:
Sorts common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) for understanding of the concepts the
categories represent

4293B234C15E4495A4C3AA3ECEEDAAF7.description: Explores and discusses word relationships and word meanings

03A387433AF44C408A616ADC03F3EFEB.description: Explores and uses new vocabulary in child-centered, authentic, play-based experiences

92C07AA299A641E5BBD04B193FE213A0.description:
Demonstrates command of the conventions of academic English capitalization, punctuation,
and spelling when writing.

EEF262D1BE1C4B5F85E54746E6A168E5.description:
Demonstrates command of the conventions of academic English grammar and usage when
writing or speaking.

F92AF0306AFA4D93B9A731CAE9C8B5F5.description:
Expresses thoughts, feelings, and ideas (e.g., role-playing, music, drawing, art work,
building, writing)

F0B576B6CA9A4145B93C1E55FB7B0451.description: Creates a visual display (e.g., drawing, art work, building, writing)

116E261A64EA49B88F425B290CA7267A.description: Describes familiar people, places, things and events

A0CEEEDAEFC04B18880090EDF943AE65.description:
Interacts with diverse formats and texts (e.g., shared read aloud, video clips, oral
storytelling)

661E6912F8304769AA4386C9CB1C8BA5.description: Considers individual differences when communicating with others

B2F97FF05705439C84997E521E2D3E7E.description: Participates in conversations through multiple exchanges

8066DF97B701418EAC52500AA8093213.description: Follows agreed-upon rules for discussions, including listening to others, taking turns, and staying on topic

28EA354C043643019B6A76D90DBAE2FA.description:
Participates in collaborative conversations with diverse peers and adults in small and large
groups and during play

ACDE704452D14B0989AF8C61A6FDDAB4.description:
Engages in a discussion using gathered information from experiences or provided
resources (e.g., collect materials from a nature walk; record and discuss what they are)

68789C52097E41379EC99E4418494361.description:
Develops questions and participates in shared research and exploration to answer
questions and to build and share knowledge (e.g., record and discuss an experiment of items that foat and sink)

9F081B09E9644D64BA6E90B5B509E12D.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

044BFE8AE5D6475EA1CFB94C01D6F939.description:
Creates a response to a text, author, or personal experience (e.g., dramatization, art work
or poem)

F78E3E256CE34AABB8B1DF270A9C9010.description:
Uses a combination of drawing, dictating, oral expression, and/or emergent writing to
narrate an event or events in a sequence

1416B86C749243F490E3BEBE9E665F18.description:
Uses a combination of drawing, dictating, oral expression, and/or emergent writing to
name a familiar topic and supply information in child-centered, authentic, play-based learning

DC7EBC9C3AC0407982AC2C8A176E405C.description:
Uses a combination of drawing, dictating, oral expression, and/or emergent writing to state
an opinion about a familiar topic in child-centered, authentic, play-based learning

86875AB855DC43558B1C10040A4F7134.description:
Makes connections between self, text, and the world (e.g., what is familiar, what does an
event/picture/character make them think of, what do they remember)

4C66B0DD5EA84D7EAC15A5008E3FBFE9.description:
Describes the relationship between illustrations and the text (e.g., what person, place, thing
or idea in the text an illustration depicts)

3853D423BA6F430E98FC366B0A01CFF2.description: Describes the role of an author and illustrator

D2D5E885C25B4F02B18A95CE6A3186AD.description: Interacts with a variety of genres (e.g., storybooks, poems, songs)

36EEDEEC5D35490EAB72E2EF52792F8E.description: Exhibits an interest in learning new vocabulary (e.g., asks questions about unfamiliar words)

981750F03BF14A56A36162B31C4F0F5C.description:
Develops and answers questions about characters, major events, and pieces of information
in a text

7D7E441D32BE401D99DCE434B43FBA11.description: Retells stories or share information from a text

EAF7882D88CC4106B6AFF3853839598B.description: Participates in discussions about a text (e.g., during whole or small group interactive readaloud discussions, during peer sharing, within play scenarios)

A3CB872FDAFE4E2AB9C6FEE400A6DE88.description: Displays emergent reading behaviors with purpose and understanding

77B23976C02A461CABFBC4A7DF7908CB.description:
Demonstrates one-to-one letter-sound correspondence by producing the primary sound of some
consonants

725E760A910743C9818086072A8503BF.description: Demonstrates emergent phonics and word analysis skills

7CC149E9B01B4ECFAA33AC60F419AD57.description: Isolates and pronounces the initial sounds (phonemes) in spoken one-syllable words (e.g., the/m/in map)

3B7BBE897F6A491BB4C7AEB82C096B1D.description: Begins to recognize individual syllables within spoken words (e.g., cup-cake, base-ball)

1FFB0E27595049DCBEED2BC5CEFF384E.description: Begins to recognize and match spoken words that rhyme (e.g., songs, chants, finger plays)

1D2CDCD775A04ECF87516142BAE35457.description:
Demonstrates an emerging understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds
(phonemes)

88950B10BBD8426393F7D9B57DDDD75B.description: Identifies front cover and back cover

01440AE50BA54C9C8BFA1AF5A4CA3383.description: Recognizes that letters are grouped to form words

DCA1486CD40C40AD9E14E8A02CE0C90D.description: Recognizes and names some upper/lowercase letters of the alphabet, especially those in own name

57427373440343E791975DAFD2EBFADF.description: Understands that words are separated by spaces in print

E32EFD3802644933996F6FDD57BEAFB2.description: Recognizes that spoken words are represented in written language

5624662DB1E04201946C992C5D25D6F9.description: Recognizes that words are read from left to right, top to bottom, and page to page

41B04F1D66D84580B11C1F7A414EC3DB.description: Demonstrates understanding of the organization and basic features of print

91D870250D264BF78261244A1A02612E.description: Writes and/or draws to communicate meaning with peers and adults during play

DDA320F7528D44ECA9697B18CDEC6F9E.description: Reviews and reflects on their own representations

005F35C65DF148788408EC1C0A0E755E.description: Uses visual media to represent an actual experience

2F871FC16C2644FEA4352A60587565D3.description: Uses existing objects to represent desired or imagined objects in play or other purposeful way

3DF36D773F4246DCB17FC9D3C678DEDB.description: Uses facial expressions, body language, gestures, or sign language to express ideas

5CAE6AF53ECA49428008044BD030CDA9.description: Demonstrates their ability to represent ideas using a variety of methods

C951CE97A29D429FB3AB52B086E9D5B5.description: Initiates conversations about a book, situation, event or print in the environment

8BA227D256E143D5B6189F15B62B877B.description: Begins to use appropriate volume and speed so that the spoken message is understood

EC398EB641474A47A8AB81F332E43A13.description: Uses new and rare words introduced by adults or peers

FABFA789D8B944F19C16C968AD89A112.description: Increasingly uses more complex words in conversations

6159B30CA51D4FB9A8D88EEFE58D3C5F.description:
Uses facial expressions, body language, gestures, home language, and/or sign language to engage in
reciprocal conversations

987E62E88F9B485697BB62F75AD37199.description:
Expresses understanding of words used in read-alouds, in conversations and in descriptions of everyday
items in the world

DAC269C1FB754A7692773797C85653D2.description:
Responds/reacts to questions/comments indicating meaning is understood (e.g., body language,
gestures, facial expressions, and words, including home language use)

D947D64C2A0747F59C82801BD3A68FBF.description: Identifies pictures related to words (e.g., points to the correct picture in book if prompted)

5F0F948465BA4B6FB7C4FDE1E1459099.description:
Makes inferences or draws conclusions based on information from visuals, including observation of
situations, peers and adults (e.g., sees another child crying and says, “he is sad”)

D0C23197AA1143338D5420B291F9EE33.description: Asks questions related to visual text and observations

7F326FD3825941C1816EE30AC94AE22A.description: Demonstrates understanding of what is observed

ACBF9F37F6B7433FA5DDC068183773E7.description: Makes comparisons to words and concepts

25E7C0411BF04E959212E3EBE32F879E.description: Attempts to use new vocabulary correctly

D03CD6C3C4954F779ECD03242C5B00F2.description:
Correctly identifies meanings of words in read-alouds, in conversation, and in descriptions of everyday
items in the world around them

128CDF1619474B49957C1507F4E5921A.description: Asks questions related to an item, event or experience

5D544191396048E4A1983E08AEF01926.description: Demonstrates they are building background knowledge

CE3070D00DC04E889F1E73E072FDFDE5.description:
Makes choices about how to communicate the ideas they want to share (e.g., gestures, scribbles, home
language, sign language, speaking)

66824A5BDB274B258343780A22DF2792.description: Initiates and extends conversations, both verbally and nonverbally

8BFE41C028A24C5F9A47E6A28B6AD8FD.description:
Listens attentively for a variety of purposes (e.g., enjoyment, to gain information, to perform a task, to learn
what happened, to follow directions)

3759FEAAF7A540AE83E2897AC745685E.description: Participates in small or large group activities for story-telling, singing or finger plays
